intro: Ruellia steyermarkii, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia steyermarkii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
